strings.PLUGIN_ABOUT: Calculator gadget Copyright 2007 Google Inc. All Rights Reserved. A nice new calculator never far from your desktop. Use it with a standard keyboard layout.
strings.PLUGIN_DESCRIPTION: Our calculator is never too far from your desktop
strings.SQRT_ERROR: SQRT cannot run for negative numbers
strings.E_EXP_DOMAIN: Cannot take the log of a negative or zero value.
strings.E_SINCOS_DOMAIN: Sin/Cos inverse requires the value to be between -1 and +1
strings.E_FACT_DOMAIN: Cannot find factorial of a negative number.
strings.E_SQRT_DOMAIN: Cannot find square root of a negative number.
strings.E_NLARGE: Number too large. Changing base and display to scientific notation.
strings.TT_C: Clears current calculations and clears the memory
strings.TT_PLUSMINUS: Changes the sign of the displayed value
strings.TT_PERCENT: Calculates the percent of the previous value. eg: 5+20% prints 1.
strings.TT_MPLUS: Adds the displayed value to memory
strings.TT_DMS: Converts the given number into deg-min-secs format. If the inverse flag is set, it assumes the input to be in that format and converts it into decimal.
strings.TT_EXPONENT: Lets you specify the exponent part of the number. eg: 3E2 will be 300.
strings.TT_FE: Toggles the display system to/from scientific mode. eg: 300 is displayed as 3E2.
strings.TT_LN: Finds the natural logarithm (euler's base) of the given number(x). If the inverse flag is set, finds e^x.
strings.TT_LOG: Finds the base-10 logarithm of the given number(x). If the inverse flag is set, finds 10^x.
strings.TT_AND: Finds the bitwise AND of two given numbers. Does rounding off before the operation.
strings.TT_OR: Finds the bitwise OR of two given numbers. Does rounding off before the operation.
strings.TT_XOR: Finds the bitwise XOR of two given numbers. Does rounding off before the operation.
strings.TT_LSH: Shifts the former number to the latter number bits left.
strings.TT_NOT: Finds the bitwise complement of the given number. Before the operation rounds the number and chooses minimal number of bits to represent it.
strings.TT_PI: Inserts the value of PI into the display.
strings.TT_MOD: Takes the remainder of the division operation.
strings.EXPR_RULES: Type in the expression and press enter. You can store variable values from A to Z. In addition u can use math function like sin, cos etc.
